node.doctext:
You probably have noticed a new "node bucket" section to your personal nodelet -- this has a couple new features which you will be interested in:

  • You can add items to it in the same manner as the normal personal nodelet
  • it allows you to drop (remove) items without going to your homenode
  • when you are on a group-type node, it will give you the option to add node in the group. This is a "safer" means of nodegroup manegement -- and works cross-browser unlike our current nodegroup editor. This also allows you to move writeups to different e2nodes!
  • You specify nodes to drop with the checkbox, if you are adding to group and you uncheck the "drop and execute" box -- that will add the node to the group, but also keep it in your node bucket.

    Please let me know if there are any problems/confusion about the new feature. This is a backport of a nodelet in the new everything core, but I've been using it on [Animefu] and it seems to work fine.

    --[nate]

    Addendum -- moving a writeup to a different e2node

    1. Go directly to the writeup in question (not it's e2node -- the actual writeup view, where you'd see the "kill" link) All writeup titles end in (person|place|thing|idea)
    2. Click on the add link in the node bucket
    3. Now go to the E2NODE that you want to insert the node into -- there should be a "launch editor" link at the top of the node, because it is a GROUP of WRITEUPS
    4. Check the box in the nodebucket for the writeup you want to drop, and click "add to group"
    5. Note that this will NOT remove the writeup from it's old e2node -- it just puts it in the new one.
node.title: Node Bucket Usage
